title: Club World Cup: the media accreditation process opens
text:
Club World Cup: the media accreditation process opens
Media interested in covering the Club World Cup Japan-2015, must send credentials via the FIFA Media Channel. The deadline to apply for accreditation is Sunday, November 22.
The tournament takes place from December 10 to 20 this year in Yokohama and Osaka . The participants are River Plate of Argentina, Auckland City of New Zealand , Club America of Mexico and FC Barcelona of Spain . In addition, the league champions of the AFC and CAF and the champion of the Japanese J League will be present.
Acreditation Process
Accreditation for print, digital and photo media shall be handled through the FIFA Media Channel.
Please note that accreditation for FIFA events is done in two stages:
1) Register through the FIFA Media Channel at: http://media.fifa.com/registration . There you will receive a notification that has been approved for access to the FIFA Media Channel.
2) Once you have a user name and password, or if you are already registered, go to: http://media.fifa.com . Choose FIFA Club World Cup Japan-2015 and complete the online form for press accreditation.
Radio and Television
There is a specific accreditation process for radio and television, including non-media rights holders. Contact: fcwc-tv@dentsu.co.jp
All applications are subject to confirmation and are not awarded in order of arrival. Notification to journalists whose applications have been accepted will be sent and later more information will come out in due time.
Visa Information
Journalists visiting Japan may need a visa to enter the country and all journalists must get their own visas on their own.
